page.title: 13GRANGE FARM
page.content: Grange Farm covers 575 acres, of which 200 acres is grassland. 70 acres of the grassland are for silage/ hay. The farm has 98 Friesian cows and 16 Charolais beef cattle. Other animals include a cow-dog and 3 cats. Machinery includes 7 tractors, a combine harvester and a trailer. The cows are milked in the parlour by machine at 5.00 a.m. and 3.30 p.m. They are fed on grass, fodder, beet, pellets, hay and silage. The average recorded milk production per cow, per annum is 6,700 litres. The cattle are freeze branded, tagged and polled. They spend the winter inside. The cattle are eventually sold or taken to the abbatoir to be humanely killed. The farmer employs 6 workers. There are about 30 ponds on the farm, and many buildings including 12 cottages.
